intro: Heteroplexis microcephala, commonly known as the dwarf false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Province of South Africa. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers clustered in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its compact size and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
